newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: FORECAST-Slovak 96 GDP to grow 6 pct,97 5 pct - OECD.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST-Slovak 96 GDP to grow 6 pct,97 5 pct - OECD.

text.p: The Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD) on Monday forecast Slovakia's real gross domestic product (GDP) would grow around six percent in 1996, slowing to five percent growth in 1997.

"(Slovakia's) real GDP is projected to grow at around six percent per a year in 1996, supported mainly by stronger domestic demand (including ambitious infrastructure programmes)" the OECD said in its first full economic survey of Slovakia.
The OECD said GDP was forecast to grow around five percent in 1997, but did not say why growth was expected to slow down.
The official Slovak Statistical Bureau (SUSR) said last week that Slovakia's real GDP rose 7.1 percent year-on-year in the first half of this year.
According to SUSR's latest forecast, full 1996 real GDP is expected to grow by 6.4 to 7.0 percent, compared with a previous projection of 7.1 percent growth.
The bureau attributed the revision to falling export demand and the central bank's tighter monetary policy.
